Dialogue: I have a way with animals.

Dialogue: Oh yes. I forgot.

Dialogue: He's beautiful.

Dialogue: She did?

Dialogue: I don't know, really. No time mostly.

Dialogue: Are you shy, Mr. Booker?

Dialogue: Enjoy the day.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: You too.

Dialogue: Shit.

Dialogue: I can handle it!

Dialogue: Uh, yes... Sure, David.

Dialogue: Thank you. You're all doing too much.

Dialogue: Oh... Well... thank you very much. I don't --

Dialogue: Sorry.  Hello? Hi, yeah, I just spoke to him. Oh, you know David, Mr. Strong Arm...

Dialogue: Can you drive?

Dialogue: Drive? I'm not old enough yet.

Dialogue: I can't...

Dialogue: I don't have all day.

Dialogue: I don't know if I can with my leg.

Dialogue: I don't know if I can.

Dialogue: Where did you get Pilgrim from?

Dialogue: That must have been pretty special.

Dialogue: Are you afraid of anything?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: It's like if I'm driving and run into a tree. When somebody asks me, "Well, what happened?", I don't say, "Well, I plowed into a tree." I don't know how you feel about talking about it and I can understand you might not want to. Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Not today -- whenever you feel like it. I leave it up to you.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Oh-oh.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: The answer's no.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: You haven't heard the question yet. Truth is, you'd be doing me a favor. I got all these eager young colts need riding and poor old Rimrock here is feeling kind of left out...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Poor thing.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: He'd be grateful, he'd take real good care with you.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Is this how you're going to make me pay my phone bill?

Dialogue: No, ma'am, I'm afraid that's extra.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Relax our center... It's just sitting in a bucket.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Yeah, it's been a while, but I... I remember the basic ideas...

Dialogue: OK. I'll stop talking then.

Dialogue: Actually, I never rode Western. I'm sorry. Go ahead.

Dialogue: Well, he don't know that. Just sit the horse.  Good... You have a nice seat.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Thanks.

Dialogue: Feel good?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: You look all right. You want to pick it up a little?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: OK.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Watch your reins, he'll go with you, give him some room, let him do the work. Relax, don't grab him with your thighs, just so long as he can feel your body.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: You want to let it go some more?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: It's a whole other world you have going on here. It just goes along, doing what it has to. And you're a part of it, you just wake up and, and there you are... And everything that seems like life or death some place else -- doesn't affect any of this one bit.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Lift your leg.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: How long did you live here with your wife?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Five years. My son was born here.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Son?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Yeah. I haven't seen him in a while. He used to come to the ranch over summers, but then he started having friends and was going off to college, so... Good boy. Hal. Lives in New York near his mom.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: How did you meet her?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: College. In Illinois. She was playing the cello. I hadn't heard cello music growing up. She had the reddest hair, the bluest eyes. When she played, it was...

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: She was the most beautiful thing I'd ever seen.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Why didn't it work out?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: She was never really happy here. She did the best she could.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Grace told me you have a country house in Connecticut. Sounds like a beautiful place.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: It is. It's lovely.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Ever think of moving there full time?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: We did at one point. When we thought we'd have more children. And we after tried. We tried everything, but... wasn't meant to be.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I hear that! See, I knew she was never going to be a ranchest, but I wanted to try -- I thought maybe she'd give music lessons to the kids in town or at the school, maybe even recitals. Speaker: annie
Dialogue: That's very important to you, isn't it? Home.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Yeah, I think it is. And I don't mean everybody's got to be married, have kids -- It's more like, knowing where you're from, where you belong, what feeds you, where you can go no matter what happens... Knowing what you're supposed to be doing while you're here.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: How did you find out all that?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I got lost.

Dialogue: Hi...

Dialogue: Would you let me ride your horse?

Dialogue: Have you talked to Tom about it?

Dialogue: Of course I have.

Dialogue: I don't know... You sure Tom said it's all right?

Dialogue: Are you going to give me a hand or aren't you?

Dialogue: You sure?

Dialogue: You okay?

Dialogue: You better not say anything!!!

Dialogue: Honey, would you see if anybody wants --

Dialogue: You look really pretty.

Dialogue: I thought there were too many forks on the table.

Dialogue: Well, one was for salad...

Dialogue: Mom, they don't mind eating with one fork.

Dialogue: You're right. Good.

Dialogue: Does anybody out there want something to drink?

Dialogue: I'll take care of it.

Dialogue: Thanks, honey.

Dialogue: Would anyone like something to drink?

Dialogue: I'll give your mom a hand.

Dialogue: Not really. I'd forgotten how long it's been since I've done this. And I couldn't get any Parmesan cheese.

Dialogue: Just make yourself comfortable.

Dialogue: I am comfortable.

Dialogue: Ha, ha... all right, well, uh I guess you can bring out the pasta.

Dialogue: You missed a button.

Dialogue: Huh?

Dialogue: Thank you.

Dialogue: Thank you.

Dialogue: I'd love to go there one time...

Dialogue: You shut up, stupid!

Dialogue: JOE!

Dialogue: What does he mean?

Dialogue: Little shit!

Dialogue: Yeah. Does that mean I'm cured?!

Dialogue: Tom?

Dialogue: Yeah, you know everything!!

Dialogue: Well, now you know what it feels like.

Dialogue: I don't deserve that. I have never looked at you as a disappointment. If I'm on your back to do better, if I push you to try harder it's because I want you to be the best you can be.

Dialogue: FOR YOU! Because I'm your daughter which means you're the best mother! Isn't that what you're always talking about in interviews -- having it all, the great career, the great family... Proving everybody wrong. Wanting everybody to think you're this perfect woman!

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Listen, if... if there's a part of you as parent that... that takes pride in your child -- that, you can look at them and see something you've accomplished as well... if that's wrong, then I'm sorry. Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Yeah, well, you've done a great job.

Dialogue: Well, then I do apologize... But what I'm most sorry for is turning you into a spoiled brat who can only think about what she's feeling... who can't admit when she's wrong and who can't forgive when she's not.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: LEAVE ME ALONE!!

Dialogue: What did you say?

Dialogue: I said... I started.

Dialogue: Started what?

Dialogue: My period.

Dialogue: When? Tonight?

Dialogue: I felt it happen downstairs and when I went into the bathroom.

Dialogue: Who's going to want me now?

Dialogue: What?... Oh baby...

Dialogue: Who's ever going to want me? Nobody will.

Dialogue: That's not true.

Dialogue: Why should they?

Dialogue: Because you are... one of the most... incredible, bravest, most beautiful woman I have ever met. The efforts you make. Your courage and your dignity.  I don't know where you got it? I honestly don't know how I would have handled all this if I were you.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I'm sorry... about what I said. It's just that -- all those times you and Daddy were trying for another kid, I... I used to pray at night that it would work. And not because of you guys or that I wanted a brother or sister... but... just so I wouldn't have to be...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Sshhh... Ssshhhh...

Dialogue: Hello?

Dialogue: Yes.

Dialogue: Oh. Oh, yes. One moment, please.

Dialogue: Who is it?

Dialogue: Uh, nothing. I'm going to pick it up in the other room -- would you hang this up for me?

Dialogue: Sure.

Dialogue: Okay, Grace...  Operator?... I'm ready.

Dialogue: I was waiting for you to come back.

Dialogue: You hungry?

Dialogue: Judith was telling me about this boy she really liked. She never even had a chance to tell me his name...

Dialogue: We were going to go around by the railroad bridge...

Dialogue: Judith... Oh God, Judith. I'm sorry...

Dialogue: I know where he goes.

Dialogue: I know you do. Don't you disappear.  I'll tell you one more thing... When Pilgrim reared up to face that truck... you know what I think?... I think that damn horse loved you so much, he was trying to protect you... That's what I think.

Dialogue: I can't... not yet...

Dialogue: There's no hurry. Take you time.

Dialogue: You!

Dialogue: I don't thinks you'd want me tripping all over you in front of everybody.

Dialogue: I wouldn't let happen.

Dialogue: Well, I have more than a few days, ha, ha... I uh... I'm sort of... not an editor anymore... right now... First time I've said it out loud.

Dialogue: They fired you?

Dialogue: No, it's more like a leave of-  Ha, ha, ha. Yeah, they fired me.

Dialogue: You don't seem to upset?

Dialogue: Delayed shock. Or maybe not. I know I could talk my way back if I wanted or... go to another magazine, someplace... Just not sure if I want to.

Dialogue: Guess you don't have to figure it out until you go home.

Dialogue: Did you always know this was the life you wanted?

Dialogue: Frank's a good man.

Dialogue: They don't come better. But I don't deny there are times I wonder about things I won't have. Maybe one day I'll get to see Egypt. Maybe not. But I know if you try too many different lives, you can wind up with no life at all...

Dialogue: Sounds like something Tom would say.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Yes, it does.

Dialogue: What?

Dialogue: Annie, I'm not good at this kind of talk -- goes round and round a thing but never comes to it -- so let's just say what it is. When you first came here, I didn't like you and I was worried. Tom means a lot to me and this family. Don't go looking here for whatever you looking for. Don't make that man go through something it took him a long time to see his way clear out of the first time.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I don't think anybody can make Tom do anything he didn't want.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: He's a good man, Tom is. He's got a gift, come from heaven above, I swear. But he's still a man. And a woman can lead a man into the middle of a mountain lake -- and still make him think he's on dry land.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Dad?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: This is Mr. Booker, Robert.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Tom.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Hi. It's a pleasure. I'm very grateful for the way you took in my girls here. I bet you were surprised when they just showed up out of nowhere.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Oh yeah...

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Well I uh... I can already see a change.  And I'm very grateful to you.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Did you notice -- no cane?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I know. Amazing.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Can we show him Pilgrim, Tom?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Oh, we're gonna show your dad plenty. Why don't you all get settled in and we'll do the tour. Excuse me.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: See you later!

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Let's bring your bags inside.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Wait till you see this -- we have the whole house to ourselves...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Is there anything you need? I'm going food-shopping.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Well, I am going to go after lunch.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: No, no, I'll go -- just give me a list.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I can't believe it's the same horse.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: We still have a way to go.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: How much longer do you think?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Well, like I told your wife, it's really up to Pilgrim.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I understand...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: We thought we lost him in the snow storm... Told the kids. Had a funeral for the damn thing. Finally, snow stops. Staring to warm up. I go out and start cleaning the truck... Goddamn if that dog doesn't jump out from the back seat covered in snow... I nearly stained myself.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: He thought it was a ghost.

Speaker: joe
Dialogue: A dog ghost!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Is the poverty worse, now, you think?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I haven't been back in over twenty years, but I wouldn't be surprised. The population's larger.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: What were you doing over in India?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Uh, this was right after college. I was in the Peace Corps.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: That right?

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: She sure loves her daddy, huh?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: ... and I thought before I settled into law school -- everybody knew that was the plan -- I'd take this time for myself.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: And I tell you, Frank, it was one of the --

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: ... one of the uh... greatest times of my life... I had experiences that, I think, changed my outlook forever. I came back a different person, literally.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: I think I'm going to have my hands full with the son of mine when you leave. Just might be his first broken heart.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Oh, how sweet.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: ... and I have no idea what he's saying because I don't understand Hindu...

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: ... So, finally I'm trying to explain to him that I'm allergic to wool and would he please get his sheep out of my car --

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Tired?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Small bed. Maybe I should sleep in the barn.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: You're allergic to hay.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I apologize for the surprise, but the days only opened yesterday and I figured...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: You don't have to explain. You have every right to come.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I can see why you put your faith in him. He's a genuine... good guy... Good at what he does. That's rare.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: You were right about coming here. I'm sorry for not thinking...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: No, it's okay. Believe me, there were plenty of times I didn't know what the hell was right.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: How are you feeling about work?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Let's not talk about that now.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I feel like I'm on a first date.

Speaker: hank's wife
Dialogue: Oh Tom, would you check the shed and see if there's anymore chairs.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: I have some brownies left over. Want one?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: No thanks.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: There's something you have to do tomorrow, boy...

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: All set?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Sure?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Smokey...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He'll be okay, Grace. Just you hang on there a minute or two. Tom'll get him, okay, you'll see...

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: There's still something going on inside of him I can't reach. So me and Smokey here, we're going to try laying him down. Okay?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: What does that mean?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: It's more or less how it sounds. Sometimes it's not pretty to watch. Some horses fight it real hard. Your fella's already shown us he likes a good fight. So if you don't want to watch, I'll call you when it's done.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I want to watch.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: You got that soft rope?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: What is he doing this?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: It'll be OK, Grace.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: He's trying to get him to go down on his knees...

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Drop the lines and come help me...

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: That's enough! Stop it!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: GRACE!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: GRACE! Will you come here, please!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Grace, I need you to come with me.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Well maybe she shouldn't be here...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Robert! Let him handle it! Please!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Grace, I need you to come with me.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: No, you're only going to hurt him some more.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: He's not hurt. He's okay. Look at him.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Grace, Listen... you've got to do this. Just trust me one more time.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Do what?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I'll show you.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I want you to lay down with him. I want you to stroke him. I want to start with his hindquarters and rub him, feel him all over.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Grace, you've got to do what I say.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Now, listen. I want you to stand on him.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: PLEASE!  Grace, do what I'm telling you. Stand on him... now!

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: It's so cruel.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: No. He had the choice.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What choice!!?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Either fight the way things are or accept it.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Oh Frank, don't forget the wedding present -- it's behind the door in the laundry room.  I got her a pasta maker from the catalogue... Not that they'll know what to do with it in Branton, Missouri... Probably use it as a planter.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Diane!

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Well, it was nice to meet you, Mr. MacLean.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Same here, Mrs. Booker. Thank you again for all your kindness.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Ah...

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Now, are you sure you want to drive that horse back yourself? There are plenty of people 'round here who do that sort of thing.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I already know the way... and it's not like I have a job I have to rush home for.  Between you and me, I could use the time alone.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: And you'll be all right by yourself here,  after they've gone?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: It's just one night. If I get uncomfortable, I'll go over to Hanks.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Promise?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Promise.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: Good luck to you, Annie.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: You too, Diane.

Speaker: diane
Dialogue: All right, everybody in. Frank, we all set...

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Shouldn't we have invited Tom over?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I did. He said he had work to do until late.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: I'll see you home... OK?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Are you going to stay in the city or go up to Connecticut?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Connecticut. I told the office I'd work out of there next week. When are you planning to start back?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Probably first thing in the morning. It's too late to start now. I'm going to try not to do too much driving in the dark.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: May I have a suggestion?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Yeah, what?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Take your time.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: You look like something's wrong.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I'll tell you something, Annie -- I stood there looking at what was happening to that horse... And, I swear, it felt like the same thing was happening to me.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I don't understa-

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: ... one way or the other.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What's the matter, honey? Gonna miss Pilgrim?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Tom's gone.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Smokey told me he left last night to look at some horses in Sheriden. He won't be back for three days. I can't believe he didn't want to say goodbye.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Well... honey... you know... that's just not his way. Maybe you can write him a letter or something. Say thank you... Don't think about it... You take care and I'll see you home.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Why do I get the feeling you know what I should do, but you're not telling me?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I won't apologize for this. And I won't hide it. Not for anybody.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I won't ask you to.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Oh, God, what are we going to do? I'm supposed to --

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Ssshhh...  Stand still, Annie. Takes what we've got, just for now. Can you do that?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Show me again.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Annie!

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: One more time.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I figured, whenever you decided to go, you'd be all set.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: How thoughtful of you. And what if I decide not to go?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Leave me alone!

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Annie, please...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: NO!... NO!... YOU DON'T DECIDE THIS!... NO!...

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: I don't know any other way, Annie.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: You think this is easy for me!?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: It's just happened this way sometimes. I can't explain it. But I look at you and see Grace and I see Robert, and no matter what you decide about him, I just know this is right. Your life isn't here and you know it.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Then what have we been doing? I mean what was the point?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: The point was to love each other.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Because we had to... And I'll never stop loving you, Annie. Here. Where my life is.

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Annie...

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Annie?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Can we go for one more ride?

Speaker: tom
Dialogue: Sure. I'll saddle them up.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Hi. Um, there doesn't seem to be any hotel room available and someone told me to come here and ask for "Tubab" who might to have a place for me to stay. Are you "Tubab"?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: No. I am a "tubab."

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Tubab means white man.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Oh, I miss you. You look beautiful.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: So do you.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: How's everything?

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: Was the trip okay?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Mmm. I made good time.  Pilgrim's in the back. I found a new stable, but they can't take him until tomorrow.

Speaker: grace
Dialogue: Great!

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Go ahead...

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: I have so much to tell you.

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: You want to take a walk with me?

Speaker: annie
Dialogue: Where to?

Speaker: robert
Dialogue: I don't know. Let's just go and... we'll see...
